metadata.title: CVE-2019-0203 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
In Apache Subversion versions up to and including 1.9.10, 1.10.4, 1.12.0, Subversion's svnserve server process may exit when a client sends certain sequences of protocol commands. This can lead to disruption for users of the server. Tomas Bortoli discovered that Subversion incorrectly handled certain svnserve requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause svnserver to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-0203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.10.6-1
libsvn-java - 1.10.6-1
libsvn-perl - 1.10.6-1
libsvn1 - 1.10.6-1
python3-subversion - 1.10.6-1
ruby-svn - 1.10.6-1
subversion - 1.10.6-1
subversion-tools - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
